intro: Carduus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, pale green leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer, consisting of both ray and disk florets. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Carduus attenuatus thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands.
